intro: Camellia tsingpienensis, commonly known as the Tsingpien camellia, is a rare and ornamental evergreen shrub native to China. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from deep red to pale pink, often with a distinctive white or yellow base. The plant has elliptical, dark green leaves that provide a striking contrast to its vibrant blooms. It thrives in partial shade and well-drained soil, making it suitable for garden cultivation in temperate climates. Due to its limited natural range and ornamental value, it is often sought after by horticulturists and plant enthusiasts.
